thread.title: Puff Daddy Says He's Not Hip Hop's First Billionaire ... Yet
thread.title_full: Puff Daddy Says He's Not Hip Hop's First Billionaire ... Yet

author: Ural Garrett
title: Puff Daddy Says He's Not Hip Hop's First Billionaire ... Yet
text:
A post shared by The Shade Room (@theshaderoom) on Feb 22, 2017 at 5:43pm PST 0 
Monday, Diddy released a video titled “For Motivational Use Only” in promotion of his Aqua Hydrate business venture. Near the commercial’s end, he says, “A young boy from Harlem, I couldn’t even be a waiter. They didn’t want me to be a waiter, so you know what I did? I became a billionaire.” 
The internet took that as a huge win for Hip Hop as Diddy received a much praise and news coverage. According to a post from his Instagram account, he simply misspoke and isn’t a billionaire yet. 
“A lot of blogs took that as I had become Hip Hop’s first billionaire,” said Diddy. “That is not the case. The race is still on. It’s up for grabs. Any of you hustlers out there come out and get it.” 
According to reports, the culture’s first person to reach ten figures could ride between Diddy, Jay Z and Dr. Dre, who was rumored to reach the status first after selling his Beats by Dre line for $3 billion. With a reported net worth of around $750 million, Diddy was also on the 2016 Forbes Hip Hop list at number 1.
